title: "im not good at support"
body: oh but you're good at pointing out what other supports do wrong and telling other people what they should do

replies.body: typical vayne player

Toxic and most of the time don't know how to work with a support (coming from a support main). Adc's need to learn how to work with a support not the other way around. I see way to many ADC"Mains" SUCK more than i do at adc.
Agreed. I don't play support much, but I think that the ADC should ALWAYS have to work around the support
I actualy play suport allot more than adc but i feel like the adc needs to choose when to go agressive ( for full on fights and when to stay and farm while the suport zones )

Support isn't that hard. You harass the enemy team, protect the carries, and ward the map. You don't have to worry about farming at all. You can carry from support by setting up your team to get fed or win teamfights.

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vPlpEE6o,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-24T16:50:36.678+0000)
>
> Support isn't that hard. You harass the enemy team, protect the carries, and ward the map. You don't have to worry about farming at all. You can carry from support by setting up your team to get fed or win teamfights.

Easiest elements of League (in order):
1. Right clicking enemies
2. Spamming spells
3. Farming

Hardest elements of League (in order):
1. On the spot reactions and decision making
2. Knowing how and when to engage/trade with opponents
3. Positioning
4. Map Awareness

Every role should know how to do everything mentioned above. For the most parts, an ADC SPECIFICALLY needs to be able to master all of the easy element and #3 of the hardest elements. SPECIFICALLY, supports have to master ALL OF THE HARDEST FEATURES IN LEAGUE and #2 of the easiest elements.

Support, in my opinion, is the 2nd hardest role (1st given to Jungle) in the game. If you think it's easy, you're probably doing it wrong.
exactly support is a fkin difficult role

There is a big difference between doing the role adequately and doing it well. If you are not a support main, you should be able to do what I outlined. If you are a support main, you need to do what you outlined. At least that is my take on it.

Need to add Lane Control in with the Hardest Elements.
(Lane Control as in freezing, slow pushing, shoving under turrets, etc...)

It's not that hard, though. It basically comes down to "Try to keep the lemming alive".

Now, being GOOD at support, that's a whole different story. Anybody can support, but few can SUPPORT.

Basically it's easy to pick up, difficult to master.
All of those are important for everyone.

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vPlpEE6o,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-24T16:50:36.678+0000)
>
> Support isn't that hard. You harass the enemy team, protect the carries, and ward the map. You don't have to worry about farming at all. You can carry from support by setting up your team to get fed or win teamfights.

not sure why you getting downvoted. Support isnt hard. whats hard is to climb as support(since it sort rely on your teammates playing well), but playing it isnt that hard.

I'm getting downvoted because people don't know the difference between someone who is a support main and someone who is filling for solo q. Mains are expected to do much more than what I stated, but non-mains only need to be able to do what I said to not hurt their team and give their ADC a decent chance to succeed.
Excuses made by people who dont wanna play it.

That's not possible, support is the easiest role. 

How can one be bad at letting themselves get carried?

EDIT:

Sweet mother of God, I never thought this thread would stay alive so long.
Sorry for my rude comment, I posted it feeling like I was on GD.  

Thanks to the guys who bothered sticking up for me, and glad to see shitposting (commenting?)
is not tolerated outside GD.

> [{quoted}](name=Xochtil,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vPlpEE6o,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-24T16:46:48.114+0000)
>
> Haha I love support. Thresh is king. Support can carry.

Thresh is the God support true but eh, unless youre like silver or lower, yeah support can carry. Once you start climbing, you NEED your team to be competent enough that when you land a hook that leads to a kill, they know how to use the gold.
I feel like its more the other way around.  low elo no matter how good of a support you are, allies often derp hardcore.  higher elo though, you can rely on your teammates FAR more
And it's for this reason right here why I hate getting shoved bot lane as the support. It matters very little how good or poorly I perform if my team can't take advantage of what I do for them.
Support can carry by the plays they set up. But they get no recognition for it. :(

Yeah, I kinda dislike that. landing a perfect 5 man ult with sona at baron securing us an ace (with some speed from my w to get my team there) and everyone congratulates Annie who got the quadra when they were stuck.
*e
Fk Thresh. All about Nautilus.

Nigga in lane, YOU AIN'T CARRYIN' SHIT. 
Without my wards,
Without my pings,
my slows,
without my exhaust,
without my stun.
You ain't shit."

Pick's hard engage support.
Goes in,
no follow up from ADC.
Gets killed 2v1
ADC complains that I won't let her farm in peace. (Brilliant idea to give the enemy hypercarry a passive lane)
Gets Mobi boots and starts to roam.
And only then do they miss having an XP leach tagging along with them. 


> [{quoted}](name=The Bard Dog,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vPlpEE6o,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-07-24T16:29:53.226+0000)
>
> oh but you're good at pointing out what other supports do wrong and telling other people what they should do

ADC mains only know what they want their support to do for them. And not, "What that support want's to do." Bullys want harass and all in potential. Hyper carries want to keep the lane passive as possible. Yet, If I first pick someone like Bard, the ADC, better be someone I don't have to babysit.

support will always be a multipliyer 

if your team is good and the support is good then the team is even better
if your team is good but the support sucks then things get hard
if the team sucks and the support is great is like multipliying for 0 nothing the support can do
I main support. I never get tired of landing thresh hooks and bringing enemies to their doom {{champion:412}}

I always find the whole "if you're not good, you cannot judge" thing to be off. One may know how something is done but can easily be inexperienced or simply unskilled at actually doing it. If there is something the person doesn't understand, than you simply tell them why what they're saying is wrong (without calling them stupid because that never helps). It can only make them a better player (unless they don't listen :P)

So the real question is whether or not the person in question is constructive and not distracting themselves from the game.

You don't need to know how to fly a plane to tell a pilot that he's bad when he crashes on a runway.
Granted, I understand that supports are often under-appreciated. As a occasional support myself, I can attest that bot lane is mostly a skill match up between the supports until the ADCs get their ultimates and core items.

I love playing support, and most of my mains are that role. I'm not as aggressively competitive as many players seem to be and like the feeling of helping. The role of support is tricky because it's easy to play support, but hard to support well until you get used to it. I've been in games with people like you've described and it's irritating but I just try to take whatever criticism they have, learn from it if I can, and ignore the negativity. Yes, in some cases I feel that the support is under appreciated but every now and then when someone acknowledges your work and says "Good Job" it brightens your day!  

My Supports: {{champion:412}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:44}}
some people can't support, i have just an instinct for CS'ing so I often take a lot of cs when i support and it makes adc rage and afk a lot. So me supporting is not a good idea.

How to not take CS as support:
1- Turn off auto-attack in settings
2- Don't click the minions.
3- ???
4- PROFIT! (But for your adc)
I don't need to be a master chef to know the food tastes like shit.

Support is pretty much the most important thing to learn.  Being that if you don't get your role, then you may be most likely to get support.  People who don't want to learn sup or who troll their last pick are those players who will be forever bronze, but I can't talk too much as I'm only silver D:<

Soloqueue support mains are my heroes. I am not a bot lane main. When I have to adc, the difference between a mediocre support and a great support takes the lane from being difficult to being a slaughterfest for our side.
The truth tea is especially strong today.

It's one thing to know what to do. It's another to actually be capable of executing it. Please stop confusing the two as the same thing.

A cripple can still make for a great sports analyst and know exactly what the players should and shouldn't do. Doesn't mean he can do it himself though.

Yes.  It's much easier to point out a mistake you've made than to actually play the character.  I can call mistakes that professional athletes make, it doesn't make me a professional athlete.  

Typical support main.
